summary:
Engineering Discipline Manager, Lead Engineer and Principal Engineer with experience in the oil and gas industry in the UK, New Zealand and the Netherlands.

Skilled in the requisitioning of Pressure Vessels (ASME, AD2000), Heat Exchangers, Columns, Flare Stacks, Furnaces, Tanks and other equipment. 

Strong engineering professional with a Bachelor of Engineering (B.Eng.) Hons in Mechanical Engineering from University of Southampton.

profile_positions.description:
Key Projects:

BP: Worley BP Program (Functional Focal Point for Mechanical Engineering)
Responsible for coordinating Mechanical discipline activities for Worley BP Program at Eefinery Rotterdam (BPRR)).

BP: TAR2024 (BPRR) (Lead Mechanical Engineer)
Discipline Lead Engineer for Select for a suite of turnaround projects scheduled for execution in 2024.

Shell: Circular Plastic (Shell Pernis) (Lead Mechanical Engineer)
Discipline Lead Engineer for Select and Define for the specification of vessels, columns, heat exchangers, air coolers, mixers and pumps for a fast-track project to design a pilot plant to prove a novel process.

BP: TAR2022 (BPRR) (Lead Mechanical Engineer)
Discipline Lead Engineer for Select, Define and Execute for a suite of turnaround projects scheduled for execution in 2022.

Shell P&T/ Shell Deutschland: SWAN Project (Rheinland Refinery, Germany) (Requisition Engineer)
Prepared specifications, datasheets, bid evaluations, vendor document reviews for purchase of Crude Furnace revamp, Flare Stack Replacement and a Tank.

BP: Revamp of Truck and Rail LPG Loading Facilities (BPRR) (Lead Mechanical Engineer)
Discipline Lead Engineer through Define and Execute for the procurement of an LPG Loading Skid.

BP: TAR2018 and associated Micro Projects (BPRR) (Lead Mechanical Engineer)
Discipline Lead Engineer through Select and into Define for a suite of turnaround projects scheduled for execution in 2018 which include: Replacement of Flare stack, Replacement of Column, Replacement of Shell and Tube Heat Exchangers and a Compressor Upgrade

Shell P&T/ Shell Deutschland: Nynas Conversion Project (Harburg Refinery, Germany) (Requisition Engineer)
Prepared specifications, datasheets, bid evaluations, vendor document reviews for purchase of  Gasketed Plate and Frame Heat Exchanger, Welded Plate and Frame Heat Exchanger, Refurbishment of Shell and Tube Heat Exchanger, Filter Vessels, Chemical Dosing Skids
profile_positions.title: Principal Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Managed 25 mechanical engineers, 15 piping designers and 5 specialist contractors working for onshore and offshore oil and gas, process plant and dairy clients.

Responsible for maintaining team’s technical delivery, chargeability and overall performance against planned hours and schedules. In order to maintain a full workload for the team, developed strong internal relationships with other Discipline Managers, Project Engineers and Project Engineering Managers in New Plymouth as well as Engineering Managers at other WorleyParson’s offices both in New Zealand and internationally.

Developed client relationships at Todd Energy, Refining New Zealand, Methanex, Origin Energy and Ballance, maintained secondees at Origin Energy in New Plymouth and at Refining New Zealand near Whangarei.

Monitored development of 9 graduate engineers and 2 trainee designers through WorleyParsons Graduate and Trainee programmes. Undertook annual Performance and Development Review for all team members.

Undertook recruitment and change management processes for the mechanical engineering discipline at WorleyParsons, interviewing candidates from graduates to lead engineers.

Mentored graduate level engineers from other disciplines .

profile_positions.title: Senior Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
At Pall Filtration I designed and project engineered pressure vessels for numerous filtration applications for the following industries: oil and gas, pharmaceutical, biotech, food and beverage, and nuclear. This involved reviewing specifications, preparing calculations, drawings, quality plans and weld dossiers in line with the PED, ASME VIII (inc U-Stamp and BPE), AD2000M and other codes. I also mentored junior engineers and assisted them with the everyday application of these design codes.

Clients included Ineos, Jacobs, Murco, Compañia Española De Petroleos, Aibel, BW Offshore, SLP Engineering, UOP NV, Hydro (Ineos) LG, Gustav Heess, BASF, Basell, Genentech, Bristol Myers Squibb, Centocor (Johnson & Johnson), Bayer, Boehringer, GSK, Novartis, Astra Zeneca, Roche, Amgen, Merck, Sanofi, Lilly, Smirnoff and Diageo.
profile_positions.title: Project Engineer (Contract Position)

profile_positions.description: At Snamprogetti I worked in the Fabricated Equipment Department (FED) on both FEED and EPC projects for clients in the Oil & Gas industry, such as SAMIR, Morocco and Shell SevenPlus, Bonny Island, Nigeria. My duties included the generation of data sheets and drawings for vessels, reactors, columns and tanks using Snamprogetti’s proprietary software, evaluation of vendor design packages and resolution of technical issues for vendors during production. This role involved liaison with the process, piping, electrical, instrumentation and civil departments within Snamprogetti as well as clients, vendors, sub-contractors and end-users of the equipment as well as visits to vendor sites to monitor progress.
profile_positions.title: Senior Fabricated Equipment Engineer

profile_positions.description: At Pall I both designed and managed the manufacture of pressure vessels for filtration applications. This involved preparing calculations, drawings, project plans, quality plans and weld dossiers in line with the European Union Pressure Equipment Directive (PED), ASME VIII (inc U-Stamp) and AD 2000 Merkblatter as well as other design codes. I managed a £750k project for BNFL Sellafield as well as numerous other projects in the £5k-£20k range for customers such as Shell, BP Grangemouth, Conoco and OGSL.
